header.#text: Clinic management training program of the Department of Veterans Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall implement a clinic management training program to provide in-person, standardized education on health care management to all managers of, and health care providers at, medical facilities of the

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall include the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Restoring Accountability in Veterans Access to Health Care Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: The clinic management training program required by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and training on customer service and veteran-centered care, including proper planning procedures for vacation, leave, and graduate medical education training schedules.

text.#text: Training on how to manage the schedules of health care providers of the
Training on the appropriate number of appointments that a health care provider should conduct on a daily basis, based on specialty.
Training on how to determine whether there are enough available appointment slots to manage demand for different appointment types and mechanisms for alerting management of insufficient slots.
Training on how scheduling systems will be monitored and how schedulers will be held accountable for accurate data.
Training on how to properly use data to meet the demand for health care, including the following:
Training on determining the next available appointment for each health care provider at the medical facility.
Training on determining the number of health care providers needed to meet demand for health care at the medical facility.
Training on determining the number of exam rooms needed to meet demand for such health care in an efficient manner.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , including any new scheduling system implemented by the

text.#text: Training on how to properly use the appointment scheduling system of the
Training on how to optimize the use of technology, including the following:
Telemedicine.
Electronic mail.
Text messaging.
Such other technologies as specified by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to ensure efficient flow and privacy for patients and staff.

text.#text: Training on how to properly use physical plant space at medical facilities of the
